level.heading: Corporate powers.
level.text: The Trust Fund may exercise those powers conferred upon a nonprofit corporation pursuant to Chapters 1 and 4 of Title 29.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 18-378 substituted "Chapters 1 and 4 of Title 29" for "subchapter I of Chapter 3 of Title 29".

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary addition of subchapter, see notes to § 4-1341.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 10-56
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 10-56, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 4-1341.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: Law 18-378, the "District of Columbia Official Code Title 29 (Business Organizations) Enactment Act of 2009", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-500, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 7, 2010, and December 21, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 27, 2011, it was assigned Act No. 18-724 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-378 became effective on July 2, 2011.
